page.title: 07AREA OF TUN BROOK
page.content:
We parked our school mini-bus near Grange Park and walked through the fields towards Tun Brook Farm. We crossed the yellow bridge over the motorway. There was a car park and some playing fields where there were several football pitches. On our left were several ponds where some people were fishing. We had to climb over a stile to walk along the path which skirts the River Ribble.
There is a view of the meander called the 'Horseshoe Bend' from this point. A hundred steps led down to the river bank. We wanted to go down them but they were slippery and muddy and the handrail was unsafe. We carried on past Red Scar and the Crematorium towards Tun Brook Farm. We reach the farm and found that it was derelict
